# Contributing

Contributions are welcome and appreciated! Every little bit helps and we will always give you credit. You can contribute in the ways listed below.

## Report issues

Report errors and other issues using the "Report issue" link at the bottom of each page.

If you are reporting an issue related to running the code, please include the following information:

* Your operating system name and version
* Whether you are running the code on {{< term Klone >}}, and if you are:
  * Whether you are running the code on a {{< term "login node" >}} or a {{< term "compute node" >}}
* Any details about your local setup that might be helpful in troubleshooting
* Detailed steps to reproduce the issue

## Fix issues

Look through the GitHub Issues for any open issues and see if there's anything you can help with. Send a [pull request](https://docs.github.com/en/pull-requests/collaborating-with-pull-requests) and we'll be happy to take a look.

## Submit Feedback

The best way to send feedback is to file an issue on GitHub.

If you are proposing a feature or change, please:

* Explain in detail how it would work or what it would cover
* Keep the scope as narrow as possible

You can also submit feedback and ask questions on the [psych-hpc](https://mailman11.u.washington.edu/mailman/listinfo/psych-hpc) mailing list.
